snippet: Anna Ushenina of Ukraine, the No. 32 seed, won the women’s world championship on Saturday, renewing questions about a tournament format for determining a champion.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes Anna Ushenina of Ukraine, the No. 32 seed, wins the women’s world championship, renewing questions about a tournament format for determining a champion.
lead_paragraph: Anna Ushenina of Ukraine, the No. 32 seed, won the women’s world championship on Saturday, renewing questions about a tournament format for determining a champion.

headline.seo: Women’s World Chess Title Won by Anna Ushenina
